poem:
Title: "Sacred Wilderness"

In sylvan silence, a wilderness waits,
In the shadow of midges, mists and mates.
Scotland's brooding shire of peat and bog,
Guardian of history, mid melody and monologue.
To gild it world heritage, the behemoth stirs,
In UNESCO's chambers, where elite discourse concurs.
Thus, bids the planet not to merely exist,
But, in its vastness, persist, resist.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. In a few weeks, Unesco is set to announce its decision on an application to allow the Flow Country in north Scotland to become a world heritage site. Such a designation is only given to places of special cultural, historical". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
